snippet: The country has been developing a new ballistic missile since the U.S. agreed in 2012 to allow it to extend the range of those arms up to 500 miles.
abstract: South Korea's Defense Ministry announces successful test-firing of its first ballistic missile with range to hit any North Korean target.
lead_paragraph: The country has been developing a new ballistic missile since the U.S. agreed in 2012 to allow it to extend the range of those arms up to 500 miles.

headline.main: South Korea Says It Tested Missile That Can Strike Anywhere in North
headline.print_headline: South Korea Says Missile It Tested Has Reach Across North
